Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body and handle of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip, the top of the handle is impressed with a stamp, comprising a double oval containing hieroglyphs.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/361 The North Suburb, South Eastern Quarter, House U.36.1.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393450) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393450)
Associated places: Named in inscription: House of Aten (?)
